sessions.name: FileMaker in Action  Custom Apps for Manufacturing and Warehouses
sessions.description: In this session, we'll cover topics that relate well to the manufacturing/warehouse space. First, two approaches to inventory; one easy-to-implement solution with unstored calcs, and a more complex solution using static fields with scripted amount updates. Next, we'll go over the creation of labels for the warehouse and how we've used automation to save a LOT of time, including taking a 60 or 90 minute process per shipment down to 30 to 60 seconds. Optionally, as time permits in the session, we will cover some of the practicalities of using FileMaker in a warehouse space.
sessions.background: Attendees should have a basic understanding of one to many relationships, calculation fields, and global fields.
sessions.objective_1: An easy approach to inventory using calculation fields
sessions.objective_2: A more complex approach to inventory using script updates to static fields
sessions.objective_3: Label creation within FileMaker to save a lot of time (looping is key)
sessions.objective_4: Practicalities of FileMaker in a warehouse space
sessions.speaker: Bradley Boggs (Chameleon Like, Inc.)

sessions.name: Intent-Driven Design: Storytelling Through Visual Narratives
sessions.description: Have you heard about storytelling in UX and how it improves usability and engagement? User intent is a starting point of a successful dialogue, and clear communication doesn't always have to be verbal. It must be concise and accessible. In this session, we will elaborate on the essence of good design: simplicity and familiarity. You will learn how to take these simple principles to demonstrate examples of visual narratives that reflect users' intent. We will be visiting a variety of user scenarios, visual elements, and interface building blocks, and learn how to sequence them to create workflows with a clear purpose and a sense of progress.
sessions.objective_1: How to improve usability and engagement through visual storytelling
sessions.objective_3: How to take simple principles to demonstrate examples of visual narratives that reflect users intent
sessions.objective_4: How to create sequences and workflows to demonstrate purpose and a sense of progress
sessions.speaker: Chih Hsiao, Esther Kim

sessions.name: DIY Digital Marketing
sessions.description: Gartner Research predicted that by 2017 CMOs would spend more than CIOs on technology. We're well past that transition and see increasing responsibility for marketers. Today, it's all about customer experience; the lines are totally blurred between new and existing customers. Without a big agency and a lot of expertise, how do you grow your business and manage the demands of your day job, all while paying attention to social media, your blog, and more? Learn the concepts and technologies in digital marketing, and leave with a concrete roadmap for putting it to work for your business.
sessions.background: You won't need a big background in marketing, but leading a product or service team, or running a business, will be helpful context for you.
sessions.objective_1: Why digital marketing is important, and how it differs from traditional marketing
sessions.objective_2: What are the tools, technologies, and terms? PPC, SEM, SEO, and so on
sessions.objective_4: Get a road map, scaled for your team and resources, that allows you to tackle digital marketing pragmatically
sessions.speaker: Scott Love (Codence)

sessions.name: FileMaker Pub Trivia
sessions.description: Join your peers and the FileMaker team for an interactive FileMaker trivia quiz. Test your knowledge, have fun, and win swag.
sessions.speaker: FileMaker Staff

sessions.name: FileMaker and Peripherals
sessions.description: You can enhance your custom apps created for iOS by using hardware peripherals that fit with FileMaker. Peripherals can add features to your app like: payment processing, bluetooth-based printing, RFcode scanning, NFC scanning,1D/2D barcode scanning, encrypted payment capture, AR, and more! This session will introduce you to examples of these peripherals and walk you through how your FileMaker app on an iOS device can communicate with peripherals so that you can take advantage of these advanced features. This session will also help you envision how peripherals can take your FileMaker Go apps to the next level.
sessions.objective_1: Introduction to peripherals that work with FileMaker Go
sessions.objective_2: How peripherals can enhance your FileMaker Go custom apps
sessions.objective_3: Learn how FileMaker apps and peripherals speak to each other
sessions.objective_4: Be inspired by real-world examples of FileMaker apps working with peripherals
sessions.speaker: Cris Ippolite (iSolutions)

sessions.name: Branding Your Own FileMaker Admin Console
sessions.description: The FileMaker Admin API allows an unparalleled amount of access towards customizing your own admin console interface.
sessions.objective_1: How the FileMaker Admin API can be used to create client-specific web apps
sessions.objective_2: Modular deployment of a console to enable or disable services
sessions.objective_3: Discussion on the value-added prospect of the FileMaker Admin API
sessions.objective_4: Making a web app "Super Admin" control panel for FileMaker Servers
sessions.speaker: Mike Beargie (MainSpring, Inc.)

sessions.name: JavaScript for FileMaker Developers
sessions.description:
JavaScript is natively supported in all parts of the FileMaker Platform. The first part of this course is focused on scope, variables, and functions, connecting those concepts to your existing FileMaker skills.
The day will be packed. We'll explore a lot, and have a good time.
sessions.background: You dont need to know any JavaScript, so come only with your FileMaker skills.
sessions.objective_1: The basics of the JavaScript language
sessions.objective_2: The peculiarities of the web viewer object on different operating systems
sessions.objective_3: How to integrate full JavaScript libraries into your custom app
sessions.objective_4: How to communicate back and forth between FileMaker and JavaScript without refreshing the web viewer
sessions.speaker: Jeremy Brown (Geist Interactive)

sessions.name: Say What!?
sessions.description: Since the beginning of time the ability to  communicate effectively has been one of the most vital necessities and cherished skills in both, personal and professional development. Whether you are an introvert, extrovert, in-house or consulting professional, every single one of us communicates with someone at some point in the day.
sessions.speaker: Brandon Hayes (Kalos Consulting Inc.)

comments.text: All the other reviewers are obviously insane, but this thing is actually pretty amazing.
When life gives you lemons, trade them for this thing.
